Reviews.Title: Check the pricing
Reviews.Author: R. Wagner "wagnerism"
Reviews.Content: At the current price, about $1050 as of 22MAR2014, brand new better models are selling for not much more on the Lenovo site.  nVidia 755M SLI, 16GB RAM, 24GB+1TB drive.  In my opinion, this is false value.  The savings here are worth getting a used product with inferior specifications

Reviews.Title: Omg Great!
Reviews.Author: FatedCb "Every one of us has a purpose here."
Reviews.Content: This thing is a beast! It will play all the latest games and do daily task without breaking a sweat! If you are looking at getting the Y510p make sure you get this model, it has everything you need.Pros:Fast!I7 processorSleek metal designMatte 1080p screenDecent webcamBacklit keyboard with 2 different levels.StylishCons:Runs a bit hotTouchpad is a disasterFingerprint magnet(impossible to remove them too)The ultrabay GPU's are still not on the market.Slow 5400 rpm hdd(really is the only cause for slowdown on this laptop)For a full review check out my youtube channelUser= CrematedFated

Reviews.Title: Do yourself a favor and buy this laptop.
Reviews.Author: NickLal
Reviews.Content: This laptop is too legit.Boots up ultra fast, has dual GPU and 16GB of RAM, what the h*ll am I suppose to do with all that RAM?But fo realz yo.This thing is gnarly, games run ultra smoothly, minecraft is maxed out with ultra detailed texture packs and doesn't lag one bit.The track pad isn't bad at all though I still use a wireless mouse anyway.It does get a tad hot when gaming and the battery doesn't last that long but aside from that and the occasional mishap typing because some keys are smaller than I'm use to, this thing is a monster of a computer.I also use it for programming and school work and it has been more than exceptional.What else...oh yeah anit-glare screen is awesome, speakers are awesome and the red back lit keyboard is even sexier in person.One last complaint, it is as everyone has said, a fingerprint magnet, but you eventually just quit giving a s*** and forget about it.So buy it, seriously if your considering it and it seems it meets your criteria just do it. I researched for literally months before I made the purchase and I'm glad I went with this choice.

Reviews.Title: Great Overall
Reviews.Author: Luke Davis
Reviews.Content: It does everything pretty much anyone could want from a laptop.People are saying it doesn't have an SSD, but it does. You can not actually store anything on it because it is used as an extended cache to greatly increase the speed of the hard drive.-finger print magnetI will update this with more information when I have the time.

Reviews.Title: Just like the description
Reviews.Author: Nshpred
Reviews.Content: Had everything in the description: dual graphics, 2.4 processor, and a ssd cache for the operating system. The operating system is the only part that sucks. Windows 8 with no Microsoft office. Runs quiet and cool while maxing out the games I have. Good buy.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Cesar
Reviews.Content: Just got my laptop today. It came with everything it says on the description except for the 8GB Solid-State Drive. This is the hard drive that includes Seagate Solid Hybrid 2 5 Inch ST1000LM014 It also has 2 video cards. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Good Computer!
Reviews.Author: Pedro
Reviews.Content: I was in search for a strong video editing laptop for a while now and I finally found the one. The Lenovo y510p 12gb of RAM is excellent for what I do. I edit in Sony Vegas Movie Studio Platinum HD 12 Suite and it hasn't gave me a problem yet. I was looking for a laptop for a while now, first I got a Macbook Pro 13.3" with 8GB of RAM and it was pretty fast but I didnt like the OS it was running in (only keeped it for 4 days). Second laptop was a Samsung ATIV Book 6 15.6" with 8GB of RAM, I hated that laptop because of the processor speed, it really sucked, plus the track pad suck and the touchscreen was irritating me (only keeped it for 4 days as well, got it on a friday, I would have returned it sooner but it was on a weekend so I had to wait till monday). And finally I got this lenovo, good speed, quad-core Intel I7 4th gen processor... Its amazingOh yea and plus, If your asking for an SSD Card on this laptop, It doesnt come with it. Its a very good deal tho for what it has, you cant be expecting an SSD card for that price, you must be crazy. If it had an ssd card this computer will easily cost way more money than what its already listed for.

Reviews.Title: For Those Who Don't
Reviews.Author: Spencer S.
Reviews.Content: So I posted this on Lenovo's page after my experience with their on-site tech today. I'm going to just keep posting this everywhere I can find.Lenovo; For Those Who Don't:January 23rd I received the IdeaPad Y510p from Lenovo, and it ran like a dream for 13 days, then I go to take my dog outside and put my laptop in sleep mode and come back in and it won't turn back on. I called in and had the option to return/refund it or repair it. I went with repair in hopes of being able to keep my data and awaited the box that tech support said I would be receiving in 3-5 days...It's the motherboard that needs replaced; power light turns on but the fans, hard drive, keyboard lights, screen, and even USB power are unresponsive. A $1,649 paperweight.20 days later I call back, having been busy with two jobs in Advertising, furious. I found out that it was never sent out and that it was just kind of forgot about. So you kindly "escalated" the repair to an on-site request after you said it would take almost twenty days for a repair and I would still have to wait, that you thought I was sending it in a second time for a second repair, and that you said I couldn't refund it until I told you I talked to a Sales Manager and they said I could and you looked into my history and found I actually did talk to someone and I could due to the situation.Well that on-site guy THAT YOU SENT OUT came today and broke the laptop even more. He lost one screw when taking it apart, forgot to put two screws back in, broke the bottom latch/lock for the laptop, part of the frame (a little plastic clip on the inside but it looks warped now) and was banging the laptop, jabbing it with his plastic tool, and kept saying "I sure hope I don't broke it, don't wanna do that!" I took pictures and cringed the whole time. I about had a stroke watching this guy "try and not break" my laptop. AND IT'S STILL NOT FIXED. It's just been sitting on my desk since I got it.This is a work laptop.I not only make money on this laptop, I spend money on it monthly for my software.I make $18 an hour at the job I got this for, and it has cut back my time there drastically. I can't work there I can only work from home. I was averaging about 3-5 hours a day until the laptop broke. Now I get less because my home computer isn't meant for this work.The software is $20 a month that I can't use.My freelance pays $30-$60 an hour just for design fees.I've lost more money because of this laptop possibly than for what it's even worth.You better get back to me soon.You have my case number.You have my name, phone number, and email.If Lenovo is for "Those Who Do" then what you need to DO is start making up for what you DON'T DO.So do something right for once and call me.This laptop has not only cost me time and money, but now it's cost me my patience.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop, one retarded flaw
Reviews.Author: BLOOD "BLOOD"
Reviews.Content: The laptop is great; however, it comes with the cheapest possible wifi card that only runs in 2.4ghz.  Just got a new router with AC, makes this thing useless.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing very expensive mistake
Reviews.Author: Judy Collins
Reviews.Content: My husband hates this laptop.  It looked real attractive and supposedly had great memory and storage and graphics, etc, but the bottom line is, he can be sitting right next to me while my HP connects just fine to the internet and he either can't get on or gets booted off repeatedly.  He also doen't like the Windows 8 and the fact that this came without any of the programs installed such as power point excel and word.  It didn't even have a cd or dvd port.  It was very expensive and he didn't get anything for his money that he can actually use.  Very frustrating!

Reviews.Title: Nice Machine but without an SSD
Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with the product itself and the one-day shipping but I am giving it a four star because it DID NOT come with an SSD, which was on the description when I made the purchase. Other than that, it is a solid buy,

Reviews.Title: Wrong product description
Reviews.Author: Boot
Reviews.Content: Unlike the other reviewer, the laptop I received did not include a SSD. This means that I can't even install my own because models that do not include SSDs do not have the connections for them either.The laptop itself is very powerful and a great buy for the price. Unfortunately the lack of the promised SSD is a huge deal breaker for me.

ProductInfo.Features:
Core i7-4700MQ 2.4 GHz (6 MB Cache)
12 GB DDR3
1000 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive, 8 GB Solid-State Drive
15.6-Inch Screen, NVIDIA Dual SLI GT 750M
Windows 8, 3-hour battery life
ProductInfo.Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Y510p 15.6-Inch Laptop (Metal - Dusk Black)
